title: Sump - Removal

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
If the engine has recently been running, the engine oil will be hot to the touch. Contact with the hot oils may cause damage to exposed skin. To avoid skin damage, do not touch hot oil.
Warning - General - Prolonged or repeated contact with engine oil

Prolonged or repeated contact with engine oil can lead to skin dryness, irritation and dermatitis. In addition, used engine oil contains potentially harmful contamination which can cause cancer. Wear suitable clothing and avoid skin contact.
The engine oil and filter must be replaced in accordance with scheduled maintenance requirements.
Sump remove - plastic guard CF7, CG7, CM7, CN7, CR7, CT7
The exhaust system will be hot if the engine has recently been running. Always allow sufficient time for the exhaust to cool before working on or near the exhaust system.
Contact with a hot exhaust could result in burn injuries.
Remove the three fixings and remove the sump guard bracket.
Remove the fixings securing the sump to the lower crankcase.
Detach the sump and collect the water pump drain tube. Remove and discard the four drain tube O-rings.

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: CF7; CX7; CT7; CR7; CN7; CM7; CG7

body.body: The water pump drain tube may remain attached to the water pump or become detached with the sump.

A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.

If the engine has recently been running, the engine oil will be hot to the touch. Contact with the hot oils may cause damage to exposed skin. To avoid skin damage, do not touch hot oil.

Prolonged or repeated contact with engine oil can lead to skin dryness, irritation and dermatitis. In addition, used engine oil contains potentially harmful contamination which can cause cancer. Wear suitable clothing and avoid skin contact.
The engine oil and filter must be replaced in accordance with scheduled maintenance requirements.
Perform the following operations:
Rider's Seat - Removal/Installation
Battery - Terminal Disconnect
Oil and Oil Filter - Renew
Plastic Sump Guard - Removal
Exhaust Header Assembly Removal
The exhaust system will be hot if the engine has recently been running. Always allow sufficient time for the exhaust to cool before working on or near the exhaust system.
Contact with a hot exhaust could result in burn injuries.
Remove the three fixings and remove the sump guard bracket.

Detach the sump and collect the water pump drain tube. Remove and discard the four drain tube O-rings.
